that's strange because i know a lot of people have Phase 4 as their favorite part of the boss ðŸ˜­
it probably also helps if you've played Calamity before
the Calamity Mod is a mod for Terraria that adds a bunch of new content, biomes, bosses, items, npcs, and etc.
one of those bosses is "The Devourer of Gods" which is this massive 4 phase worm boss
it has 4 different themes that transition into each other https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wjOj_6cMGEY
here's a video of all 4 of the themes transitioning into each other, you don't gotta listen
but the song in MSRe Boss 3 Phase 4 is the final part of this
"Universal Collapse"
it's based on a remix DM Dokuro made of Cave Story's "Running Hell"
MSRe Solgryn took 3 people over the course of a month
MSRe TJ & Klazen took 5 people over the course of 3 months
MSRe Biff is still in progress
Biff is the final boss of Cultured 1 and 2, specifically 2 for MSRe
the reason i spend so much time working on MSRe is because i use it as a place to experiment with ideas that wouldn't work anywhere else
I could not have made Schwarlitz's Requiem, 100 Floor Medley, or Pepper if I had not first made MSRe
KTNG2
Needle Games
but yeah
needle medley
KTNG 1 and 2 have a unique style where they don't have screen picks, they have save picks
so instead of it being an entire screen from a needle game, it's just a single save
meaning if there's a game with an awesome save but also a save that's just 12 double diamonds, you don't have to pick the 12 double diamonds
and can just pick the good save
i tried to have all of the secret boss needle sections balance out in difficulty, and i knew this was harder than usual, and to compensate the 2nd save is very free
this screen is more gimmick needle forward while the next screen is more puzzle pathing forward
100% this is a reference to Salt and i will take the complaint that it's bad, because it is bad alicen20W
i probably wouldn't have done specifically that if i made the game today
i may have still referenced it but not to this extent

i make games i would want to play and i play games that i enjoy playing, therefore i make games i enjoy playing
i have not beaten every game i've made (shoutouts to Schwarlitz) but i made it with the intention of enjoying playing it

The Trolley Problem: a train is heading towards 5 people tied to a train track, and it is impossible for you to reach them in time to get them off. Next to you, however, is a lever which would divert the train to a sepatare track, which has one person tied to it. Do you do nothing and allow the 5 people to die, or do you involve yourself in the situation to cause the 1 person who wouldn't have died to die, while saving the 5 people.
